files.description: Theme configuration with dark-first design, vibrant Spotify Wrapped-inspired gradients, custom CSS variables for brand colors (deep purples, electric blues, neon greens, hot pinks), animation tokens, and typography scale.

Global CSS with Tailwind v4 imports, custom CSS variables for theme colors, gradient definitions, glow effects, animation keyframes (slide-up, fade-in, scale-pop, shimmer, pulse-glow), dark mode defaults, and scrollbar styling.
Font configuration using next/font for Inter (body) and Space Grotesk or Outfit (headings). Exports font className variables.

Root layout with ThemeProvider (next-themes), AdsenseScript import, ScrollProgress, BackToTop, CookieConsent from shared components. Conditionally shows navbar (hidden on /wrapped for fullscreen experience). Wraps children in global providers (GitDataProvider, AuthProvider).

Main navigation bar with logo ('gitted'), nav links (Dashboard, Story, Wrapped, Gource), ThemeToggle import from shared, user avatar dropdown (connected GitHub user), and mobile hamburger menu. Sticky with backdrop blur on scroll.
Site footer with links, GitHub attribution, privacy policy link, and subtle branding. Includes AdUnit placement.
Sidebar navigation component used on dashboard and detail pages. Shows repo list, quick links to Story/Wrapped/Gource, and analytics sections.

Auth context provider managing Claude OAuth token and GitHub OAuth state. Stores tokens in localStorage with encryption. Provides isAuthenticated, githubUser, claudeToken, login/logout methods. Wraps app in layout.

Git data context provider that holds all fetched repository data, commit history, analytics results, and generated stories. Acts as the SINGLE source of truth for all git-related state. Provides methods to fetch, cache, and invalidate data.

Zustand store for global app state: selectedRepos (string[]), processingStatus (idle|fetching|analyzing|generating), currentView, wrappedSlideIndex, gourcePlaybackState, error states. All pages read from this store.

GitHub API client using Octokit. Functions: fetchUserRepos(token, page, perPage), fetchRepoCommits(owner, repo, since?, until?, page?), fetchRepoContributors(owner, repo), fetchRepoLanguages(owner, repo), fetchRepoBranches(owner, repo), fetchRepoStats(owner, repo). Handles pagination automatically for large repos. Implements smart batching: for repos with 1000+ commits, fetches summary stats first, then detailed commits in chunks. Rate limit aware with retry logic.

Claude API client for AI-powered story generation. Functions: generateRepoStory(commitSummary, repoMeta), generateUnifiedStory(allRepoSummaries), generateRepoSummary(commits), generateSuperlatives(analytics). Implements smart batching: chunks thousands of commits into summarized batches, sends progressive summaries to Claude. Handles token limits and streaming responses.

Core analytics computation engine (pure TypeScript, no React). Functions: computeContributionHeatmap(commits), computeCommitFrequency(commits, granularity), computeLanguageBreakdown(repos), computeCodingPatterns(commits) (peak hours, days), computeStreaks(commits), computeProductivityMetrics(commits), computeYearOverYear(commits), computeMonthlyBreakdown(commits), computeSuperlatives(commits, repos). Efficiently processes thousands of commits using Maps and pre-sorted arrays.

Commit data processor and normalizer. Takes raw GitHub API commit data and normalizes it into internal CommitData format. Handles deduplication across repos, timezone normalization, merge commit detection, and creates sorted indices for efficient querying. Implements chunked processing for 10k+ commits to avoid blocking the main thread.

Gource visualization engine using Canvas 2D / WebGL. Implements file tree layout algorithm: directories as branches radiating from center, files as leaf nodes. Animation system: commits appear as pulses from contributor avatars to affected files. Supports: multi-repo combined view (different color per repo), time-based playback with configurable speed, camera pan/zoom, date filtering. Uses requestAnimationFrame game loop. Efficiently handles large trees by culling off-screen nodes and LOD (level of detail) for distant nodes.

Force-directed and radial layout algorithms for the gource visualization. Computes node positions for file tree, handles dynamic addition/removal of nodes as commits progress through time. Implements spatial indexing (quadtree) for efficient collision detection and neighbor lookup. Manages branch spring physics and node repulsion.

Canvas/WebGL renderer for gource visualization. Draws nodes (files as circles colored by extension), edges (directory connections as curved lines), contributor avatars (with GitHub profile images), commit beams (animated lines from avatar to file), labels (directory names), and particle effects. Handles high-DPI rendering, anti-aliasing, and performance optimization via dirty rect tracking.
Hook wrapping GitHub OAuth flow. Returns { initiateOAuth, isConnected, user, repos, disconnect }. Handles the OAuth redirect callback, stores token, and triggers initial repo fetch.

Hook for fetching and paginating GitHub repositories. Returns { repos, isLoading, hasMore, loadMore, search, filter }. Implements infinite scroll pagination, client-side search/filter by name/language/stars, and caches results.

Hook that computes analytics from git data context. Returns memoized { heatmap, commitFrequency, languageBreakdown, codingPatterns, streaks, productivity, yearOverYear, superlatives }. Triggers recomputation only when selected repos or commit data changes. Uses web workers for heavy computation if available.
Hook managing gource animation playback state. Returns { isPlaying, speed, currentTime, totalDuration, play, pause, setSpeed, seek, currentDate }. Interfaces with gource-engine via refs.
Hook managing wrapped slideshow state. Returns { currentSlide, totalSlides, next, prev, goTo, isAnimating, slideData }. Handles auto-advance timing, animation states, and preloads next slide data.

Hook managing AI story generation. Returns { stories, unifiedStory, isGenerating, progress, generateStory, regenerate }. Calls Claude API with batched commit data, handles streaming responses, caches results.

Landing page with hero section featuring animated gradient background, 3D-style floating commit nodes animation, bold headline ('Your Git Story, Beautifully Told'), subheadline, and 'Get Started' CTA button linking to /connect. Imports AdUnit for placement after hero.

Hero section with animated background (CSS gradient animation + floating particle dots representing commits), large headline with gradient text, description, and primary CTA button. Uses framer-motion for entrance animations.

Feature cards section showing 4 main features: Story (book icon), Wrapped (music note icon), Gource (tree icon), Analytics (chart icon). Each card has icon, title, description, and hover animation with gradient border glow.

Animated preview section showing mockups of wrapped cards and gource visualization in action. Uses CSS animations and intersection observer for scroll-triggered animations. Shows a mini gource tree visualization and a sample wrapped stat card.
Step-by-step section: 1) Connect GitHub, 2) Select Repos, 3) Generate Your Story. Each step has number, icon, title, and description. Connected by animated dotted lines.
Bottom call-to-action section with bold text, gradient background, and large 'Start Your Git Story' button. Includes social proof stats (repos analyzed, stories generated) with animated counters.

Connect page with two-phase flow: Phase 1 - Enter Claude API key and connect GitHub OAuth. Phase 2 - Repository selector with search, filter, select all, and metadata display. Proceed button at bottom. Uses useGitHubAuth and useRepoFetcher hooks.

Card component for entering Claude OAuth/API token. Has a password-type input, validation indicator (checks token format), help text explaining where to get the token, and a 'Verify' button that tests the token.
GitHub OAuth connection card. Shows 'Connect GitHub' button with GitHub icon, displays connected user info (avatar, name, public/private repo count) after connection. Handles OAuth redirect flow.

Repository list component with search bar, language filter dropdown, sort options (stars, name, last updated), and infinite scroll. Each repo row shows: checkbox, repo name, description truncated, language badge, star count, commit count estimate, last updated. Supports select all / deselect all. Groups by org/personal.
Sticky bottom bar showing count of selected repos, estimated total commits, and a 'Generate My Story' button. Shows processing estimate based on commit count. Animates repo count changes.

Dashboard page that reads from git data context and analytics hook. Displays overview stats cards, contribution heatmap, commit timeline, language breakdown, coding patterns, and navigation cards to Story/Wrapped/Gource. Protected route - redirects to /connect if no repos selected.

Grid of stat cards showing: Total Commits, Total Repos, Lines Added (green), Lines Removed (red), Active Days, Longest Streak. Each card has icon, value with animated counter, label, and sparkline mini-chart. Uses gradient backgrounds.

GitHub-style contribution heatmap calendar showing commit density per day for the selected time range. Color intensity maps to commit count. Tooltips show date and count. Supports year selection. Built with SVG rectangles.

Interactive line/area chart showing commit frequency over time. Supports granularity toggle (daily, weekly, monthly). Uses Recharts. Hover shows exact counts. Can overlay multiple repos as separate lines with legend.

Donut chart showing language distribution across all selected repos, with a sortable table below listing each language, percentage, line count, and repo count. Uses Recharts for the chart and color-coded language badges.
Visualizations of coding habits: a radar chart of commits by day of week, a heatmap of commits by hour of day, and a 'peak productivity' summary card showing the user's most active times.
Three large feature cards linking to Story, Wrapped, and Gource pages. Each has an animated icon/preview, title, description, and arrow button. Gradient borders on hover.

Story page that uses useStoryGenerator hook. Shows a loading state with progress bar while Claude generates stories. Once complete, displays the unified developer journey narrative and per-repo story cards. Has chapter navigation sidebar.
Story page header with 'Your Developer Journey' title, date range subtitle, and a 'Regenerate Story' button. Shows generation status (generating/complete/error).

Long-form narrative section displaying the AI-generated unified story across all repos. Rendered as styled prose with chapters, milestone callouts (boxed highlights), and inline commit reference links. Supports markdown rendering with custom styling.

Grid of expandable cards, one per selected repo. Each card shows repo name, language badge, date range, a brief story summary, and expands to show full AI-generated narrative. Cards have repo-themed gradient headers.

Vertical timeline visualization showing key milestones extracted from commit history and AI analysis. Each milestone node shows date, repo, event title, and description. Animated scroll-reveal. Color-coded by repo.
Floating sidebar/drawer navigation listing story chapters and per-repo sections. Highlights current section based on scroll position. Click to smooth-scroll to section.
Share dialog component allowing users to share their story via link, Twitter, or download as PDF. Generates a shareable card image using html2canvas.

Wrapped slideshow page - fullscreen immersive experience. Uses useWrappedSlideshow hook. Renders current slide component based on slideIndex. Handles swipe gestures and keyboard navigation (arrow keys). Hides navbar for fullscreen mode. Tap/click to advance.

Container component for wrapped slides. Handles entrance/exit animations (slide, fade, scale), background gradient transitions between slides, progress dots indicator at top, and swipe gesture detection.
Opening slide: 'Your 2024 Git Wrapped' with animated text reveal, user's GitHub avatar, and total commit count animating up. Pulsing gradient background.
Slide showing top 5 repos by commit count. Animated bar chart that builds up. Each repo shows name, commit count, and a rank badge. Bold typography with gradient text.
Slide showing productivity stats: most productive month, most productive day of week, average commits per day, total active days. Animated number counters and mini-charts.
Animated slide showing language usage over time as an evolving stacked area or bubble chart. Languages animate in/out as they gain/lose prominence across the timeline.
Slide showing streak records: longest streak (with dates), current streak, most commits in single day (with date and count), weekend warrior percentage. Flame/fire emoji animations for streaks.
Slide showing 12-month breakdown as animated circular chart or card grid. Each month shows commit count and top repo. Highlights the peak month with special animation.
Slide comparing year-over-year stats if multi-year data available. Shows growth/decline arrows, percentage changes. Animated side-by-side comparison bars.
Fun superlatives slide: 'Night Owl' or 'Early Bird', 'Weekend Warrior' or 'Weekday Warrior', most used commit word, longest commit message, etc. Award badges with playful animations.

Final slide summarizing the year: total commits, repos contributed to, days active, top language. Big gradient card with 'Share Your Wrapped' and 'Download Image' buttons. Confetti animation on reveal.
Share component that generates downloadable image cards of wrapped stats using html2canvas. Supports sharing to Twitter, LinkedIn, and copying a link. Each slide can be individually shared.

Gource visualization page. Initializes gource engine on mount, renders Canvas element, shows playback controls and timeline scrubber. Uses useGourcePlayback hook. Supports repo selector tabs for individual or combined view.

Main Canvas component that hosts the gource visualization. Manages canvas sizing (fullscreen responsive), handles mouse events for pan/zoom, initializes GourceEngine with commit data, and manages the render loop. Uses refs to avoid React re-render overhead.

Overlay controls for gource playback: play/pause button, speed selector (0.5x, 1x, 2x, 5x, 10x), current date display, fullscreen toggle. Semi-transparent dark background, positioned at bottom of viewer.
Horizontal timeline scrubber showing the full date range. Draggable handle to seek to any point in time. Shows commit density as a mini histogram along the track. Marks major milestones.
Side panel listing all contributors with their assigned colors and GitHub avatars. Shows per-contributor commit counts. Click to highlight/solo a contributor in the visualization.
Tab bar above gource viewer for switching between individual repo views and the 'All Repos' combined view. Each tab shows repo name and a colored dot matching its gource color.
Settings drawer/dialog for gource: node size, edge thickness, show/hide labels, show/hide avatars, background color, date filter range, file extension color mapping, bloom/glow effects toggle.

Repository detail page. Reads repo ID from params, fetches detailed data from git data context. Shows repo header, commit history graph, contributor breakdown, file change treemap, code frequency chart, AI summary, and quick links to that repo's Story/Wrapped/Gource.
Repo detail header with repo name, description, language badge, star/fork/watcher counts, GitHub link, date range of analysis, and last commit info. Gradient banner based on primary language color.
Interactive commit history line chart for single repo. X-axis is time, Y-axis is commits. Brush/zoom enabled. Hover shows commit details. Uses Recharts.
Horizontal bar chart of contributors ranked by commit count. Shows avatar, name, commit count, percentage, and lines changed. Expandable to show contributor timeline.
Treemap visualization showing directory/file structure sized by change frequency. Color-coded by file type. Click to drill into subdirectories. Uses Recharts Treemap.
Stacked area chart showing additions (green) and deletions (red) per week. Visualizes code churn over the repo's lifetime. Uses Recharts.
AI-generated summary card for the single repo. Shows a 2-3 paragraph narrative, key milestones list, technology evolution notes, and a 'Read Full Story' link to the Story page filtered to this repo.
Card grid with 3 quick-link cards: View Story (for this repo), View in Wrapped, View Gource. Each links to the respective page with the repo pre-selected/highlighted.
GitHub OAuth callback API route. Receives authorization code, exchanges for access token using client secret, returns token to client. Stores in secure httpOnly cookie.
API route to fetch user repos. Accepts GitHub token from cookie/header, returns paginated repo list with metadata. Supports search query and sort parameters.

API route to fetch commits for a repo or batch of repos. Accepts repo owner/name, optional date range, pagination. Implements server-side batching for large repos (fetches in parallel chunks). Returns normalized commit data.

API route for Claude story generation. Accepts commit summaries and repo metadata. Calls Claude API with smart batching (summarizes commits in chunks before final generation). Supports streaming response for real-time progress. Returns generated story markdown.

API route for server-side analytics computation. Accepts raw commit data, runs analytics-engine computations, returns computed analytics (heatmap, frequency, patterns, superlatives). Offloads heavy computation from client.

Client-side caching utility using IndexedDB (via idb). Caches fetched commits, computed analytics, and generated stories with TTL-based invalidation. Prevents re-fetching on page navigation. Functions: get(key), set(key, data, ttl), clear(), has(key).
Static content for landing page: hero text, feature descriptions, how-it-works steps, CTA text, social proof stats placeholders, footer content.
Content templates for wrapped slides: slide titles, subtitle templates (with placeholders for stats), superlative labels and descriptions, share text templates, fun facts templates.

Claude prompt templates for story generation: unified story system prompt, per-repo story prompt, summary prompt for commit batching, milestone extraction prompt, superlatives prompt. Includes few-shot examples for quality output.

Repository Detail page: Deep-dive page for a single selected repository. Shows detailed analytics: commit history graph, contributor breakdown, file change treemap, branch activity, PR/issue stats, code frequency by week, top contributors, and an AI-generated summary of the repo's evolution. Links to that repo's individual Story, Wrapped slide, and Gource visualization.

agents.description: Creates the dark-first theme with Spotify Wrapped-inspired aesthetics. Vibrant gradient system (purple → pink → blue → green), glow effects, animation tokens, typography scale. Sets up CSS variables, global styles, and font configuration.

Creates root layout with providers (ThemeProvider, AuthProvider, GitDataProvider), conditional navbar (hidden on /wrapped), footer, and global state store. Imports shared components (ThemeToggle, BackToTop, ScrollProgress, CookieConsent, AdsenseScript).

Creates all API routes (GitHub OAuth callback, repos, commits, story generation, analytics computation) and core libraries (GitHub API client, Claude API client, analytics engine, commit processor, cache manager).
Landing page with animated hero, feature overview cards, preview animations, how-it-works steps, and bottom CTA. Dark themed with vibrant gradients. AdUnit placements after hero and before CTA.
Connect/setup page with Claude token input, GitHub OAuth flow, paginated repository selector with search/filter, and selected repos summary with generate button.
Main analytics dashboard with stats cards, contribution heatmap, commit timeline chart, language breakdown, coding patterns, and navigation cards to other sections. Uses useAnalytics hook.

AI-generated story page with unified developer journey narrative, per-repo story cards, milestone timeline, chapter navigation, and share functionality. Uses useStoryGenerator hook for Claude integration.

Spotify Wrapped-style fullscreen slideshow with 9+ animated slides, swipe/keyboard navigation, progress indicators, gradient transitions, and share/download functionality. Each slide reveals a stat with bold animations.

Gource visualization page with Canvas-based animated file tree, playback controls, timeline scrubber, contributor legend, repo selector tabs, and visualization settings. Implements custom gource engine with force-directed layout and WebGL rendering.

Repository detail page with commit history graph, contributor breakdown, file change treemap, code frequency chart, AI-generated summary, and quick links to Story/Wrapped/Gource for that specific repo.
Static content for landing page, wrapped slide templates, and Claude prompt templates for story generation. Includes text, labels, prompt engineering for quality AI output.

Ad placement integration using the pre-built AdUnit shared component. Ensures AdUnit components are placed strategically on landing page (after hero, before CTA) and dashboard (sidebar), with max 2-3 placements per page.

thirdPartyDeps.name: recharts
thirdPartyDeps.reason: All charts: line charts, area charts, bar charts, donut charts, treemaps, radar charts on dashboard, repo detail, and wrapped slides

thirdPartyDeps.name: framer-motion
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Page transitions, slide animations in wrapped, scroll-reveal animations, card hover effects, counter animations throughout the app

thirdPartyDeps.name: zustand
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Global app state store for selected repos, processing status, wrapped slide state, gource playback state

thirdPartyDeps.name: @octokit/rest
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Type-safe GitHub API client for fetching repos, commits, contributors, languages, and handling pagination/rate limits

thirdPartyDeps.name: date-fns
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Date formatting, date range calculations, relative time, calendar computations for heatmap and timeline charts

thirdPartyDeps.name: html2canvas

thirdPartyDeps.name: react-markdown

thirdPartyDeps.name: idb
thirdPartyDeps.reason: IndexedDB wrapper for client-side caching of fetched commits, computed analytics, and generated stories

thirdPartyDeps.name: next-themes
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Dark/light theme switching with system preference detection, used by ThemeProvider in layout

thirdPartyDeps.name: canvas-confetti
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Confetti animation on wrapped final summary slide and story generation completion

thirdPartyDeps.name: zod@3
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Schema validation for API route inputs, form validation for Claude token and settings, type-safe data parsing

thirdPartyDeps.name: react-use-gesture
thirdPartyDeps.reason: Swipe gesture detection for wrapped slideshow navigation on mobile devices

wiringRules: Rule 1: AuthProvider (src/context/auth-provider.tsx) is the SINGLE source of truth for authentication state. It stores claudeToken and githubToken. All pages and API calls must read auth tokens from AuthProvider via useContext, never from localStorage directly. AuthProvider must be initialized in the root layout BEFORE GitDataProvider.

Rule 2: GitDataProvider (src/context/git-data-provider.tsx) is the SINGLE source of truth for all fetched git data (repos, commits, contributors, languages). It wraps the app inside AuthProvider. Pages must NOT fetch git data independently — they must call GitDataProvider methods (fetchRepos, fetchCommits, etc.) which internally use github-api.ts and cache-manager.ts.

Rule 3: The app-store (zustand) manages UI state: selectedRepos[], processingStatus, currentWrappedSlide, gourcePlaybackState. Pages read from this store via hooks. The Connect page writes selectedRepos, Dashboard/Story/Wrapped/Gource pages read them. If selectedRepos is empty, Dashboard/Story/Wrapped/Gource pages must redirect to /connect.

Rule 4: Data fetching flow: Connect page → user selects repos → app-store.setSelectedRepos() → user clicks Generate → GitDataProvider.fetchCommitsForRepos(selectedRepos) → commits stored in GitDataProvider → app-store.setProcessingStatus('analyzing') → API route /api/analytics/compute processes data → results stored in GitDataProvider → app-store.setProcessingStatus('idle') → redirect to /dashboard.

Rule 5: Analytics computation chain: Raw commits from GitDataProvider → analytics-engine.ts functions (computeContributionHeatmap, computeCommitFrequency, etc.) → useAnalytics hook memoizes results → Dashboard/Wrapped components consume via hook. The useAnalytics hook must recompute ONLY when GitDataProvider's commit data or app-store's selectedRepos changes.

Rule 6: Story generation chain: User navigates to /story → useStoryGenerator checks GitDataProvider for commits → calls commit-processor.ts to batch/summarize commits → sends batched summaries to /api/story/generate (which calls claude-api.ts) → streaming response updates progress in useStoryGenerator → final stories cached in GitDataProvider via cache-manager.ts.

Rule 7: Claude API integration: claude-api.ts requires the claudeToken from AuthProvider. The story/generate API route receives the token in the Authorization header. For repos with 1000+ commits, commit-processor.ts MUST summarize commits into batches of ~100 before sending to Claude. Each batch is summarized, then summaries are combined for final story generation. This prevents token limit issues.

Rule 8: Wrapped slideshow flow: /wrapped page reads analytics from useAnalytics hook (which reads from GitDataProvider) → useWrappedSlideshow hook manages slide index and animation state → each slide component receives its specific data as props from the parent container → wrapped-slide-container.tsx handles transitions between slides. The page must set document body to overflow:hidden for fullscreen mode and restore on unmount.

Rule 9: Gource engine initialization order: GourceEngine constructor receives commitData and repoMetadata → GourceLayout.initialize(commitData) builds initial node tree → GourceRenderer.initialize(canvasElement) sets up Canvas context → GourceEngine.start() begins requestAnimationFrame loop. The loop calls: GourceLayout.update(currentTime) → GourceRenderer.render(nodes, edges, avatars). useGourcePlayback hook controls play/pause/speed via GourceEngine methods.

Rule 10: Gource data flow: GitDataProvider provides commits sorted by date → gource-engine.ts maintains a currentTimeIndex that advances based on playback speed → at each frame, new commits up to currentTime are processed: files are added/modified as nodes, contributors appear as avatars → gource-layout.ts computes positions using force-directed algorithm → gource-renderer.ts draws the scene. Canvas must be resized on window resize events.

Rule 11: Cache strategy: cache-manager.ts uses IndexedDB via 'idb' package. Keys follow pattern: 'repos:{userId}', 'commits:{repoFullName}', 'analytics:{selectedRepoHash}', 'story:{repoFullName}', 'story:unified:{selectedRepoHash}'. TTL is 1 hour for commits, 24 hours for analytics and stories. GitDataProvider checks cache before API calls. Cache is cleared when selectedRepos changes.

Rule 12: Repository detail page (/repo/[id]) reads repo data from GitDataProvider using the [id] param (which is the repo full name URL-encoded). It must NOT re-fetch from GitHub — it uses cached data from GitDataProvider. If data is not in GitDataProvider (user navigated directly), it fetches on mount and stores in GitDataProvider.

Rule 13: GitHub OAuth flow: Connect page calls useGitHubAuth.initiateOAuth() → redirects to GitHub OAuth URL with client_id → GitHub redirects back to /api/github/callback → callback route exchanges code for token → stores token in httpOnly cookie → redirects to /connect with success param → useGitHubAuth detects token in cookie → sets isConnected=true in AuthProvider → triggers repo fetch.

Rule 14: Navbar visibility: The root layout checks the current pathname. If pathname is '/wrapped', the navbar is hidden and the page renders fullscreen. For all other routes, navbar and footer are shown. This is handled via a client component wrapper in layout.tsx that uses usePathname().

Rule 15: Ad placements: AdUnit from @/components/shared/ad-unit is imported and placed by page components (NOT the layout). Landing page places one AdUnit after features-overview section and one before cta-section. Dashboard places one AdUnit in the sidebar area. Maximum 2-3 ad units site-wide per page view. AdUnit must not render inside the /wrapped fullscreen experience.

Rule 16: Share functionality: share-wrapped.tsx and share-story.tsx both use html2canvas to capture DOM elements as images. They must wait for all animations to complete before capturing. The captured image is offered as PNG download and can be shared via Web Share API (navigator.share) with fallback to clipboard copy. Share text templates come from wrapped-content.ts and story-prompts.ts.

Rule 17: Error handling chain: All API calls (github-api.ts, claude-api.ts) throw typed errors → API routes catch and return appropriate HTTP status codes → GitDataProvider catches and stores errors in state → pages check for errors and display error UI with retry buttons. Rate limit errors from GitHub trigger a countdown timer showing when to retry.

Rule 18: Commit processor batching strategy: For repos with <500 commits, all commits are sent to analytics-engine directly. For 500-5000 commits, commits are processed in chunks of 500 with intermediate results merged. For 5000+ commits, server-side processing via /api/analytics/compute is used. This threshold logic lives in GitDataProvider.fetchCommitsForRepos().
